title: Goals Book
description: Goals are needs of the target organization, which the system will address.

title: Context and overall objective
description: High-level view of the project: organizational context and reason for building a system.

title: Current situation
description: Current state of processes to be addressed by the project and the resulting system.

title: Expected benefits
description: New processes, or improvement to existing processes, made possible by the projectâ€™s results.

title: Functionality overview
description: Overview of the functions (behavior) of the system. Principal properties only.

title: High-level usage scenarios
description: Fundamental usage paths through the system.

title: Limitations and exclusions
description: Aspects that the system need not address.

title: Stakeholders and requirements sources
description: Groups of people who can affect the project or be affected by it.

title: Environment Book
description: The Environment book describes the application domain and the environment in which the system will operate.

title: Glossary
description: Definitions of terms used in the project.

title: Components
description: Description of the components of the environment.

title: Constraints
description: Constraints imposed on the system by the environment.

title: Assumptions
description: Assumptions about the environment.

title: Effects
description: Effects of the system on the environment.

title: Invariants
description: Properties of the environment that must be preserved.

title: Project Book
description: The Project book describes the project management aspects.

title: Roles and personnel
description: Roles and personnel involved in the project.

title: Tools and techniques
description: Tools and techniques used in the project.

title: Project management
description: Project management aspects.

title: Validation
description: Validation aspects.

title: Verification
description: Verification aspects.

title: Configuration management
description: Configuration management aspects.

title: Documentation
description: Documentation aspects.

title: System Book
description: The System book refines the Goal one by focusing on more detailed requirements.

title: Components
description: Overall structure expressed by the list of major software and hardware parts.

title: Functionality
description: One section for each of the components identified above, describing the corresponding behaviors.

title: Interfaces
description: How the system makes the functionality available to the rest of the world (UI/API).

title: Detailed usage scenarios
description: Examples of interaction between the environment and the system: use cases, user stories.

title: Prioritization
description: Classification of the behaviors, interfaces and scenarios by their degree of criticality.

title: Verification and acceptance criteria
description: Specification of the conditions under which an implementation will be deemed satisfactory.
